newsitem.title: USA: Allstate seeks to cut some insurance rates.
newsitem.headline: Allstate seeks to cut some insurance rates.

text.p: Allstate Corp said Monday its Allstate Insurance unit would lower statewide auto insurance rates in California by an average of seven percent.

Allstate filed with California insurance regulators to increase the discounts it offers to motorists with good driving records, the company said. The rate reduction is expected to go into effect in January 1997, Allstate said.
It is the second auto rate reduction filed by Allstate in California this year. A rate decrease averaging 2.7 percent went into effect July 29.
Allstate is the nation's second-largest personal lines insurance company, providing insurance coverage to more than 20 million customers.
